member.name: M:PloobsEngine.Utils.VectorUtils.GetSignedAngleBetween2DVectors(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3)
member.summary: Find the angle between two vectors. This will not only give the angle difference, but the direction. For example, it may give you -1 radian, or 1 radian, depending on the direction. Angle given will be the angle from the FromVector to the DestVector, in radians.

member.returns: Signed angle, in radians
member.remarks: All three vectors must lie along the same plane.

member.name: M:PloobsEngine.Physics.BepuPhysicWorld.ApplyDefaultSettings(PloobsEngine.Physics.BepuPhysicWorld)
member.summary: Applies the default settings to the space. These values are what the engine starts with; they don't have to be applied unless you just want to get back to the defaults. This doesn't cover every single tunable field in the entire engine, just the main ones that this helper class is messing with.

member.name: M:PloobsEngine.Physics.BepuPhysicWorld.ApplyRotationSettings
member.summary: Applies some rotation-related settings. With these settings enabled, rotation generally behaves better with long shapes. Angular motion is more realistic since the momentum is conserved. However, these settings can also cause some instability to sneak into the simulation. Try using these settings on the Saw Contraption demo to see an example of what can go wrong when conservation is enabled.

member.name: M:PloobsEngine.Physics.BepuPhysicWorld.ApplySemiSpeedySettings
member.summary: Applies slightly higher speed settings. The only change here is the default minimum iterations. In many simulations, having a minimum iteration count of 0 works just fine. It's a quick and still fairly robust way to get some extra performance. An example of where this might introduce some issues is sphere stacking.

member.name: M:PloobsEngine.Physics.BepuPhysicWorld.ApplySuperSpeedySettings(PloobsEngine.Physics.BepuPhysicWorld)
member.summary: Applies some low quality, high speed settings. The main benefit comes from the very low iteration cap. By enabling simplex caching, general convex collision detection gets a nice chunk faster, but some curved shapes lose collision detection robustness.

member.name: M:PloobsEngine.Physics.BepuPhysicWorld.ApplyMediumHighStabilitySettings(PloobsEngine.Physics.BepuPhysicWorld)
member.summary: Applies some higher quality settings. By using universal continuous collision detection, missed collisions will be much, much rarer. This actually doesn't have a huge performance cost. The increased iterations put this as a midpoint between the normal and high stability settings.

member.name: M:PloobsEngine.Physics.BepuPhysicWorld.ApplyHighStabilitySettings(PloobsEngine.Physics.BepuPhysicWorld)
member.summary: Applies some high quality, low performance settings. By using universal continuous collision detection, missed collisions will be much, much rarer. This actually doesn't have a huge performance cost. However, increasing the iteration limit and the minimum iterations to 5x the default will incur a pretty hefty overhead. On the upside, pretty much every simulation will be rock-solid.

member.name: M:PloobsEngine.Utils.MathUtils.BlendIntoAccumulator(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single@)
member.summary: blends new values into an accumulator to produce a smoothed time series
member.remarks: Modifies its third argument, a reference to the float accumulator holding the "smoothed time series." The first argument (smoothRate) is typically made proportional to "dt" the simulation time step. If smoothRate is 0 the accumulator will not change, if smoothRate is 1 the accumulator will be set to the new value with no smoothing. Useful values are "near zero".

member.summary: Blends the parameter into the accumulator.

member.summary: Attempts to acquire a lock on the solver updateable. This allows operations that need exclusive access to the solver updateable's members. If it is contested, it aborts the attempt.
member.returns: Whether or not the lock could be acquired.

member.summary: Acquires a lock on the solver updateable. This allows operations that need exclusive access to the solver updateable's members.

member.summary: Releases the lock on the solver updateable.

member.summary: Updates the activity state of the solver updateable based on its members.

member.summary: Called after the object is added to a space.

member.summary: Called before an object is removed from its space.

member.summary: Gets the solver to which the solver updateable belongs.

member.summary: Gets the solver settings that manage how the solver updates.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.SolverSystems.SolverUpdateable.IsActive
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether or not this solver updateable is active.
When set to false, this solver updateable will be idle and its isActiveInSolver field will always be false.
When set to true, the solver updateable will run normally and update if the type's activity conditions allow it.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.SolverSystems.SolverUpdateable.IsActiveInSolver
member.summary: Gets whether or not the space's solver should try to solve this object. Depends on conditions specific to each solver updateable type and whether or not it has completed its computations early. Recomputed each frame.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.SolverSystems.SolverUpdateable.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets the user data associated with this object.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Constraints.EntitySolverUpdateable
member.summary: Superclass of objects types which require solving by the velocity solver. These are updated within the internal iterative solver when owned by a space.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Constraints.EntitySolverUpdateable.involvedEntities
member.summary: List of all entities affected by this updateable.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Constraints.EntitySolverUpdateable.numberOfInvolvedEntities
member.summary: Number of entities used in the solver updateable. Note that this is set automatically by the sortInvolvedEntities method if it is called.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.EntitySolverUpdateable.EnterLock
member.summary: Acquires exclusive access to all entities involved in the solver updateable.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.EntitySolverUpdateable.ExitLock
member.summary: Releases exclusive access to the updateable's entities. This should be called within a 'finally' block following a 'try' block containing the locked operations.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.EntitySolverUpdateable.TryEnterLock
member.summary: Attempts to acquire exclusive access to all entities involved in the solver updateable.
member.returns: Whether or not the lock was entered successfully.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.EntitySolverUpdateable.CollectInvolvedEntities(BEPUphysics.DataStructures.RawList{BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity})
member.summary: Adds entities associated with the solver item to the involved entities list. This allows the non-batched multithreading system to lock properly.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.EntitySolverUpdateable.OnInvolvedEntitiesChanged
member.summary: Handle any bookkeeping needed when the entities involved in this SolverUpdateable change.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.EntitySolverUpdateable.CollectInvolvedEntities
member.summary: Collects the entities involved in a solver updateable and sets up the internal listings.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.EntitySolverUpdateable.SortInvolvedEntities
member.summary: Sorts the involved entities according to their hashcode to allow non-batched multithreading to avoid deadlocks.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.EntitySolverUpdateable.UpdateSolverActivity
member.summary: Sets the activity state of the constraint based on the activity state of its connections. Called automatically by the space owning a constaint. If a constraint is a sub-constraint that hasn't been directly added to the space, this may need to be called alongside the preStep from within the parent constraint.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.EntitySolverUpdateable.InvolvedEntities
member.summary: Gets the entities that this solver updateable is involved with.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.EntitySolverUpdateable.SolverGroup
member.summary: Gets the solver group that manages this solver updateable, if any. Null if not owned by a solver group.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.UpdateableSystems.ISpaceUpdateable
member.summary: Defines an object which is updated by the space. These refer to the special Updateable types which allow for easier integration into the update flow of the space.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.UpdateableSystems.ISpaceUpdateable.IsUpdatedSequentially
member.summary: Gets and sets whether or not the updateable should be updated sequentially even in a multithreaded space. If this is true, the updateable can make use of the space's ThreadManager for internal multithreading.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Collidables.Events.PairCreatedEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic when two objects' bounding boxes overlap as determined by the broadphase system.
member.param: Other entry within the pair opposing the monitored entry.
Pair presiding over the interaction of the two involved bodies. This reference cannot be safely kept outside of the scope of the handler; pairs can quickly return to the resource pool.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Collidables.Events.CreatingPairEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic when two objects' bounding boxes overlap as determined by the broadphase system. Unlike PairCreatedEventHandler, this will be called as soon as a pair is created instead of at the end of the frame. This allows the pair's data to be adjusted prior to any usage, but some actions are not supported due to the execution stage.
member.param: Other entry within the pair opposing the monitored entry.
Pair presiding over the interaction of the two involved bodies. This reference cannot be safely kept outside of the scope of the handler; pairs can quickly return to the resource pool.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Collidables.Events.PairRemovedEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic when two objects' bounding boxes cease to overlap as determined by the broadphase system.
member.param: The entry formerly interacting with the sender via the deleted pair.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Collidables.Events.RemovingPairEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic when two objects' bounding boxes cease to overlap as determined by the broadphase system. Unlike PairRemovedEventHandler, this will trigger at the time of pair removal instead of at the end of the space's update.
member.param: The entry formerly interacting with the sender via the deleted pair.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Collidables.Events.ContactCreatedEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic when two bodies are touching and generate a contact point.
member.param: Other entry within the pair opposing the monitored entry.
Pair presiding over the interaction of the two involved bodies. This reference cannot be safely kept outside of the scope of the handler; pairs can quickly return to the resource pool.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Collidables.Events.CreatingContactEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic when two bodies are touching and generate a contact point. Unlike ContactCreatedEventHandler, this will trigger at the time of contact generation instead of at the end of the space's update. This allows the contact's data to be adjusted prior to usage in the velocity solver, but other actions such as altering the owning space's pair or entry listings are unsafe.
member.param: Other entry within the pair opposing the monitored entry.
Pair presiding over the interaction of the two involved bodies. This reference cannot be safely kept outside of the scope of the handler; pairs can quickly return to the resource pool.
Newly generated contact point between the pair's two bodies. This reference cannot be safely kept outside of the scope of the handler; contacts can quickly return to the resource pool.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Collidables.Events.InitialCollisionDetectedEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic when two bodies initally collide and generate a contact point.
member.param: Other entry within the pair opposing the monitored entry.
Pair presiding over the interaction of the two involved bodies. This reference cannot be safely kept outside of the scope of the handler; pairs can quickly return to the resource pool.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Collidables.Events.DetectingInitialCollisionEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic when two bodies initally collide and generate a contact point. Unlike InitialCollisionDetectedEventHandler, this will trigger at the time of contact creation instead of at the end of the space's update. Performing operations outside of the scope of the pair is unsafe.
member.param: Other entry within the pair opposing the monitored entry.
Pair presiding over the interaction of the two involved bodies. This reference cannot be safely kept outside of the scope of the handler; pairs can quickly return to the resource pool.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Collidables.Events.ContactRemovedEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic when a contact point between two bodies is removed.
member.param: Other entry within the pair opposing the monitored entry.

Pair presiding over the interaction of the two involved bodies and data about the removed contact. This reference cannot be safely kept outside of the scope of the handler; pairs can quickly return to the resource pool.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Collidables.Events.RemovingContactEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic when a contact point between two bodies is removed. Unlike ContactRemovedEventHandler, this will trigger at the time of contact removal instead of at the end of the space's update. Performing operations outside of the scope of the controller is unsafe.
member.param: Other entry within the pair opposing the monitored entry.

Pair presiding over the interaction of the two involved bodies and data about the removed contact. This reference cannot be safely kept outside of the scope of the handler; pairs can quickly return to the resource pool.
Contact between the two entries. This reference cannot be safely kept outside of the scope of the handler; it will be immediately returned to the resource pool after the event handler completes.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Collidables.Events.CollisionEndedEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic when two bodies go from a touching state to a separated state.
member.param: Other entry within the pair opposing the monitored entry.
Pair overseeing the collision. Note that this instance may be invalid if the entries' bounding boxes no longer overlap.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Collidables.Events.CollisionEndingEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic when two bodies go from a touching state to a separated state. Unlike CollisionEndedEventHandler, this will trigger at the time of contact removal instead of at the end of the space's update. Performing operations outside of the scope of the controller is unsafe.
member.param: Other entry within the pair opposing the monitored entry.
Pair presiding over the interaction of the two involved bodies. This reference cannot be safely kept outside of the scope of the handler; pairs can quickly return to the resource pool.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Collidables.Events.PairUpdatedEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic to perform at the end of a pair's UpdateContactManifold method. This is called every single update regardless if the process was quit early or did not complete due to interaction rules.
member.param: Entry involved in the pair monitored for events.
Other entry within the pair opposing the monitored entry.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Collidables.Events.PairUpdatingEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic to perform at the end of a pair's UpdateContactManifold method. This is called every single update regardless if the process was quit early or did not complete due to interaction rules. Unlike PairUpdatedEventHandler, this is called at the time of the collision detection update rather than at the end of the space's update. Other entries' information may not be up to date, and operations acting on data outside of the character controller may be unsafe.
member.param: Entry involved in the pair monitored for events.
Other entry within the pair opposing the monitored entry.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Collidables.Events.PairTouchedEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic to perform at the end of a pair's UpdateContactManifold method if the two objects are colliding. This is called every single update regardless if the process was quit early or did not complete due to interaction rules.
member.param: Entry involved in the pair monitored for events.
Other entry within the pair opposing the monitored entry.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Collidables.Events.PairTouchingEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic to perform at the end of a pair's UpdateContactManifold method if the two objects are colliding. This is called every single update regardless if the process was quit early or did not complete due to interaction rules. Unlike PairTouchedEventHandler, this is called at the time of the collision detection update rather than at the end of the space's update. Other entries' information may not be up to date, and operations acting on data outside of the character controller may be unsafe.
member.param: Entry involved in the pair monitored for events.
Other entry within the pair opposing the monitored entry.

member.summary: Gets whether or not the member is active.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.BufferedStates
member.summary: Gets the buffered states of the entity. If the Space.BufferedStates manager is enabled, this property provides access to the buffered and interpolated states of the entity. Buffered states are the most recent completed update values, while interpolated states are the previous values blended with the current frame's values. Interpolated states are helpful when updating the engine with internal time stepping, giving entity motion a smooth appearance even when updates aren't occurring consistently every frame. Both are buffered for asynchronous access.

Place where the suspension hooks up to the body of the vehicle.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Paths.SpeedControlledCurve`1
member.summary: Wrapper that controls the speed at which a curve is traversed.

remarks.para: Even if a curve is evaluated at linearly increasing positions, the distance between consecutive values can be different. This has the effect of a curve-following object having variable velocity.
To counteract the variable velocity, this wrapper samples the curve and produces a reparameterized, distance-based curve. Changing the evaluated curve position will linearly change the value.

member.summary: Constructs a new swing limit. To finish the initialization, specify the connections (ConnectionA and ConnectionB) as well as the TwistAxis (or its entity-local version), the MaximumAngleX and MaximumAngleY, and the Basis. This constructor sets the constraint's IsActive property to false by default.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.EllipseSwingLimit.#ctor(BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity,BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Constructs a new swing limit.
member.param: First entity connected by the constraint.
Second entity connected by the constraint.

Axis in world space to use as the initial unrestricted twist direction. This direction will be transformed to entity A's local space to form the basis's primary axis and to entity B's local space to form its twist axis. The basis's x and y axis are automatically created from the twist axis.
Maximum angle of rotation around the basis X axis.
Maximum angle of rotation around the basis Y axis.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.EllipseSwingLimit.#ctor(BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity,BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity)
member.summary: Constructs a new swing limit. Using this constructor will leave the limit uninitialized. Before using the limit in a simulation, be sure to set the basis axes using limit.basis.setLocalAxes or limit.basis.setWorldAxes and b's twist axis using the localTwistAxisB or twistAxisB properties.
member.param: First entity connected by the constraint.
Second entity connected by the constraint.

member.summary: Gets the basis attached to entity A. The primary axis is the "twist" axis attached to entity A. The xAxis is the axis around which the angle will be limited by maximumAngleX. Similarly, the yAxis is the axis around which the angle will be limited by maximumAngleY.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Collidables.InstancedMesh
member.summary: Collidable mesh which can be created from a reusable InstancedMeshShape. Very little data is needed for each individual InstancedMesh object, allowing a complicated mesh to be repeated many times. Since the hierarchy used to accelerate collisions is purely local, it may be marginally slower than an individual StaticMesh.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Collidables.InstancedMesh.#ctor(BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.InstancedMeshShape)
member.summary: Constructs a new InstancedMesh.

member.param: Shape to use for the instance.
Transform to use for the instance.

member.summary: Tests a ray against the entry.
member.param: Maximum length, in units of the ray's direction's length, to test.
Hit location of the ray on the entry, if any.
member.returns: Whether or not the ray hit the entry.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Collidables.InstancedMesh.RayCast(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Ray,System.Single,BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.ConvexShapes.TriangleSidedness,BEPUphysics.RayHit@)
member.summary: Tests a ray against the instance.
member.param: Maximum length of the ray to test; in units of the ray's direction's length.
Sidedness to use during the ray cast. This does not have to be the same as the mesh's sidedness.
The hit location of the ray on the mesh, if any.
member.returns: Whether or not the ray hit the mesh.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Collidables.InstancedMesh.WorldTransform
member.summary: Gets or sets the world transform of the mesh.

member.summary: Gets the shape used by the instanced mesh.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Collidables.InstancedMesh.Sidedness
member.summary: Gets or sets the sidedness of the mesh. This can be used to ignore collisions and rays coming from a direction relative to the winding of the triangle.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Collidables.InstancedMesh.ImproveBoundaryBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not the collision system should attempt to improve contact behavior at the boundaries between triangles. This has a slight performance cost, but prevents objects sliding across a triangle boundary from 'bumping,' and otherwise improves the robustness of contacts at edges and vertices.

This constructs the internal constraints, but does not configure them. Before using a constraint constructed in this manner, ensure that its active constituent constraints are properly configured. member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SingleEntity.MaximumLinearSpeedConstraint.Softness
member.summary: Gets and sets the softness of this constraint. Higher values of softness allow the constraint to be violated more. Must be greater than zero. Sometimes, if a joint system is unstable, increasing the softness of the involved constraints will make it settle down. For motors, softness can be used to implement damping. For a damping constant k, the appropriate softness is 1/k.

member.summary: Manages the engine's threads.
member.remarks: The thread manager is constructed with certain access assumptions in mind. When implementing custom thread managers, ensure that the requirements are met or exceeded with regard to concurrent access.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Threading.IThreadManager.EnqueueTask(System.Action{System.Object},System.Object)
member.summary: Enqueues a task to the thread manager. This should be safe to call from multiple threads and from other tasks.
member.param: Data to give to the task.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Threading.IThreadManager.ForLoop(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Action{System.Int32})
member.summary: Loops from the starting index (inclusive) to the ending index (exclusive), calling the loopBody at each iteration. The forLoop function will not return until all iterations are complete. This is meant to be used in a 'fork-join' model; only a single thread should be running a forLoop at any time.
member.param: Function that handles an individual iteration of the loop.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Threading.IThreadManager.RemoveThread
member.summary: Removes a worker thread from the engine.

member.summary: Waits until all tasks enqueued using enqueueTask are complete.

member.summary: Constructs a new constraint which restricts two degrees of linear freedom and two degrees of angular freedom between two entities. This constructs the internal constraints, but does not configure them. Before using a constraint constructed in this manner, ensure that its active constituent constraints are properly configured. The entire group as well as all internal constraints are initially inactive (IsActive = false).

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverGroups.UniversalJoint
member.summary: Restricts three degrees of linear motion and one degree of angular motion. Acts like two hinges in immediate sequence.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverGroups.UniversalJoint.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new constraint which restricts three degrees of linear freedom and one degree of twisting angular freedom between two entities. This constructs the internal constraints, but does not configure them. Before using a constraint constructed in this manner, ensure that its active constituent constraints are properly configured. The entire group as well as all internal constraints are initially inactive (IsActive = false).

Second entity of the constraint pair.
Point around which both entities rotate in world space.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverGroups.UniversalJoint.BallSocketJoint
member.summary: Gets the ball socket joint that restricts linear degrees of freedom.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverGroups.UniversalJoint.Limit
member.summary: Gets the rotational limit of the universal joint. This constraint overlaps with the twistJoint; if the limit is activated, the twistJoint should be generally deactivated and vice versa.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverGroups.UniversalJoint.Motor
member.summary: Gets the motor of the universal joint. This constraint overlaps with the twistJoint; if the motor is activated, the twistJoint should generally be deactivated and vice versa.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverGroups.UniversalJoint.TwistJoint
member.summary: Gets the angular joint which removes one twisting degree of freedom.

member.summary: Constructs a new constraint which restricts three degrees of linear freedom and one degree of angular freedom between two entities. This constructs the internal constraints, but does not configure them. Before using a constraint constructed in this manner, ensure that its active constituent constraints are properly configured. The entire group as well as all internal constraints are initially inactive (IsActive = false).

member.summary: Prevents the target entity from moving faster than the specified speeds.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SingleEntity.MaximumAngularSpeedConstraint.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a maximum speed constraint. Set its Entity and MaximumSpeed to complete the configuration. IsActive also starts as false with this constructor.

member.summary: Constructs a maximum speed constraint.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SingleEntity.MaximumAngularSpeedConstraint.SolveIteration
member.summary: Calculates and applies corrective impulses. Called automatically by space.

member.summary: Calculates necessary information for velocity solving. Called automatically by space.
member.param: Time in seconds since the last update.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SingleEntity.MaximumAngularSpeedConstraint.MaximumForce
member.summary: Gets and sets the maximum impulse that the constraint will attempt to apply when satisfying its requirements. This field can be used to simulate friction in a constraint.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SingleEntity.MaximumAngularSpeedConstraint.MaximumSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum angular speed that this constraint allows.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SingleEntity.MaximumAngularSpeedConstraint.Softness
member.summary: Gets and sets the softness of this constraint. Higher values of softness allow the constraint to be violated more. Must be greater than zero. Sometimes, if a joint system is unstable, increasing the softness of the involved constraints will make it settle down. For motors, softness can be used to implement damping. For a damping constant k, the appropriate softness is 1/k.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SingleEntity.MaximumAngularSpeedConstraint.TotalImpulse
member.summary: Gets the total impulse applied by the constraint.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.ConvexShapes.InertiaHelper
member.summary: Helper class used to compute volume distribution information, which is in turn used to compute inertia tensor information.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.ConvexShapes.InertiaHelper.InertiaTensorScale
member.summary: Value to scale any created entities' inertia tensors by. Larger tensors (above 1) improve stiffness of constraints and contacts, while smaller values (towards 1) are closer to 'realistic' behavior. If MotionUpdateSettings.padInertiaTensors is enabled, this value can be reduced significantly or all the way to 1 while maintaining fairly good behavior. Defaults to 2.5.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.ConvexShapes.InertiaHelper.NumberOfSamplesPerDimension
member.summary: Number of samples the system takes along a side of an object's AABB when voxelizing it.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.MotorMode
member.summary: Defines the behavior style of a motor.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.MotorMode.VelocityMotor
member.summary:
Velocity motors only work to try to reach some relative velocity. They have no position goal.
When this type is selected, the motor settings' velocityMotor data will be used.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.MotorMode.Servomechanism
member.summary:
Servomechanisms change their velocity in order to reach some position goal.
When this type is selected, the motor settings' servo data will be used.

member.summary: Contains genereal settings for motors.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.MotorSettings.MaximumForce
member.summary: Gets and sets the maximum impulse that the constraint will attempt to apply when satisfying its requirements. This field can be used to simulate friction in a constraint.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.MotorSettings.Mode
member.summary:
Gets or sets what kind of motor this is.
If velocityMotor is chosen, the motor will try to achieve some velocity using the VelocityMotorSettings. If servomechanism is chosen, the motor will try to reach some position using the ServoSettings.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.MotorSettings1D.VelocityMotor

member.summary: Speed at which the servo will try to achieve its goal.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.ServoSettings.maxCorrectiveVelocitySquared
member.summary: Squared maximum extra velocity that the constraint will apply in an effort to correct constraint error.

member.summary: Spring settings define how a constraint responds to velocity and position error.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.ServoSettings.BaseCorrectiveSpeed
member.summary: Gets and sets the speed at which the servo will try to achieve its goal. This is inactive if the constraint is not in servo mode.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.ServoSettings.MaxCorrectiveVelocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum extra velocity that the constraint will apply in an effort to correct any constraint error.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.ServoSettings.SpringSettings
member.summary: Gets the spring settings used by the constraint. Spring settings define how a constraint responds to velocity and position error.

member.summary: Defines the behavior of a servo that works on one degree of freedom. Used when the MotorSettings' motorType is set to servomechanism.

member.summary: Gets or sets the goal position of the servo.

member.summary: Defines the behavior of a servo that works on three degrees of freedom. Used when the MotorSettings' motorType is set to servomechanism.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.ServoSettings3D.Goal
member.summary: Gets or sets the goal position of the servo.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.ServoSettingsOrientation
member.summary: Defines the behavior of a servo that works on the relative orientation of two entities. Used when the MotorSettings' motorType is set to servomechanism.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.ServoSettingsOrientation.Goal
member.summary: Gets or sets the goal orientation of the servo.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.VelocityMotorSettings
member.summary: Defines the behavior of a velocity motor. Used when the MotorSettings' motorType is set to velocityMotor.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.VelocityMotorSettings.softness
member.summary: Softness of this constraint. Higher values of softness allow the constraint to be violated more. Must be greater than zero. Sometimes, if a joint system is unstable, increasing the softness of the involved constraints will make it settle down.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.VelocityMotorSettings.Softness
member.summary: Gets and sets the softness of this constraint. Higher values of softness allow the constraint to be violated more. Must be greater than zero. Sometimes, if a joint system is unstable, increasing the softness of the involved constraints will make it settle down. For motors, softness can be used to implement damping. For a damping constant k, the appropriate softness is 1/k.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.VelocityMotorSettings1D
member.summary: Defines the behavior of a velocity motor that works on one degree of freedom. Used when the MotorSettings' motorType is set to velocityMotor.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.VelocityMotorSettings1D.GoalVelocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the goal velocity of the motor.

member.summary: Restricts the linear and angular motion between two entities.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverGroups.WeldJoint.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new constraint which restricts the linear and angular motion between two entities. This constructs the internal constraints, but does not configure them. Before using a constraint constructed in this manner, ensure that its active constituent constraints are properly configured. The entire group as well as all internal constraints are initially inactive (IsActive = false).

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverGroups.CustomizableSolverGroup
member.summary:
Constraint made from other constraints. Putting constraints into a solver group can help with organization and, in some cases, performance.
If you have multiple constraints between the same two entities, putting the constraints into a CustomizableSolverGroup can lower lock contention.
Be careful about overloading a single solvergroup; it should be kept relatively small to ensure that the multithreading loads stay balanced.

member.summary: Removes a solver updateable from the solver group.

member.summary: Loops from the starting index (inclusive) to the ending index (exclusive), calling the loopBody at each iteration. The forLoop function will not return until all iterations are complete. This is meant to be used in a 'fork-join' model; only a single thread should be running a forLoop at any time.
member.param: Function that handles an individual iteration of the loop.

member.summary: Releases threads and resources used by the thread manager.

member.summary: Enqueues a task. This method also does not perform any locking; it should only be called when all worker threads of the thread pool are idle and all calls to this method are from the same thread.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRule
member.summary: Defines a set of rules that collisions can adhere to.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRule.Defer
member.summary: Yields the interaction type's determination to a later stage.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRule.Normal
member.summary: Uses all of collision detection, including creating a collision pair, creating contacts when appropriate, and responding to those contacts physically. If a collision pair is forced to use a 'normal' interaction but both entities in the pair are kinematic, the collision response will be skipped.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRule.NoSolver
member.summary: Creates a collision pair and undergoes narrow phase testing, but does not collision response in the solver.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRule.NoNarrowPhaseUpdate
member.summary: Creates a broad phase overlap and narrow phase pair but the collision is never updated. It cannot generate contacts nor undergo solving.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRule.NoNarrowPhasePair
member.summary: Creates a broad phase overlap but does not create any narrow phase pairs. It cannot generate contacts nor undergo solving.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRule.NoBroadPhase
member.summary: Does not create a broad phase overlap. No further collision detection or response takes place.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Space.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.TimeStepSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets the time step settings used by the space.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.ThreadManager
member.summary: Gets or sets the thread manager used by the space.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.SpaceObjectBuffer
member.summary: Gets or sets the space object buffer used by the space. The space object buffer allows objects to be safely asynchronously added to and removed from the space.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.EntityStateWriteBuffer
member.summary: Gets or sets the entity state write buffer used by the space. The write buffer contains buffered writes to entity states that are flushed each frame when the buffer is updated.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.DeactivationManager
member.summary: Gets or sets the deactivation manager used by the space. The deactivation manager controls the activity state objects, putting them to sleep and managing the connections between objects and simulation islands.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.ForceUpdater
member.summary: Gets or sets the force updater used by the space. The force updater applies forces to all dynamic objects in the space each frame.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.BoundingBoxUpdater
member.summary: Gets or sets the bounding box updater used by the space. The bounding box updater updates the bounding box of mobile collidables each frame.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.BroadPhase
member.summary: Gets or sets the broad phase used by the space. The broad phase finds overlaps between broad phase entries and passes them off to the narrow phase for processing.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.NarrowPhase
member.summary: Gets or sets the narrow phase used by the space. The narrow phase uses overlaps found by the broad phase to create pair handlers. Those pair handlers can go on to create things like contacts and constraints.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.Solver
member.summary: Gets or sets the solver used by the space. The solver iteratively finds a solution to the constraints in the simulation.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.PositionUpdater
member.summary: Gets or sets the position updater used by the space. The position updater moves everything around each frame.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.BufferedStates
member.summary: Gets or sets the buffered states manager used by the space. The buffered states manager keeps track of read buffered entity states and also interpolated states based on the time remaining from internal time steps.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.DeferredEventDispatcher
member.summary: Gets or sets the deferred event dispatcher used by the space. The event dispatcher gathers up deferred events created over the course of a timestep and dispatches them sequentially at the end.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.DuringForcesUpdateables
member.summary: Gets or sets the updateable manager that handles updateables that update during force application.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.BeforeNarrowPhaseUpdateables
member.summary: Gets or sets the updateable manager that handles updateables that update before the narrow phase.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.EndOfTimeStepUpdateables
member.summary: Gets or sets the updateable manager that handles updateables that update at the end of a timestep.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.EndOfFrameUpdateables
member.summary: Gets or sets the updateable manager that handles updateables that update at the end of a frame.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.Entities
member.summary: Gets the list of entities in the space.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Paths.CurveEndpointBehavior
member.summary: Defines how a curve behaves beyond an endpoint.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Paths.CurveEndpointBehavior.Wrap
member.summary: When the time exceeds the endpoint, it wraps around to the other end of the curve.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Paths.CurveEndpointBehavior.Clamp
member.summary: Times exceeding the endpoint are clamped to the endpoint's value.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Paths.CurveEndpointBehavior.Mirror
member.summary: Times exceeding the endpoint will reverse direction and sample backwards.

member.summary: Constructs a new constraint which prevents the connected entities from rotating relative to each other around an axis beyond given limits. To finish the initialization, specify the connections (ConnectionA and ConnectionB) as well as the TestAxis (or its entity-local version) and the Basis. This constructor sets the constraint's IsActive property to false by default.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.RevoluteLimit.#ctor(BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity,BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Constructs a new constraint which prevents the connected entities from rotating relative to each other around an axis beyond given limits.
member.param: Axis of rotation to be limited.
Axis attached to connectionB that is tested to determine the current angle. Will also be used as the base rotation axis representing 0 degrees.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.RevoluteLimit.#ctor(BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity,BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity)
member.summary: Constructs a new constraint which prevents the connected entities from rotating relative to each other around an axis beyond given limits. Using this constructor will leave the limit uninitialized. Before using the limit in a simulation, be sure to set the basis axes using Basis.SetLocalAxes or Basis.SetWorldAxes and the test axis using the LocalTestAxis or TestAxis properties.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.RevoluteLimit.GetMassMatrix(BEPUphysics.MathExtensions.Matrix2X2@)
member.summary: Gets the mass matrix of the revolute limit. The revolute limit is special; in terms of solving, it is actually sometimes TWO constraints; a minimum plane, and a maximum plane. The M11 field represents the minimum plane mass matrix and the M22 field represents the maximum plane mass matrix.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.RevoluteLimit.SolveIteration
member.summary: Computes one iteration of the constraint to meet the solver updateable's goal.
member.returns: The rough applied impulse magnitude.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.RevoluteLimit.Update(System.Single)
member.summary: Performs the frame's configuration step.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.RevoluteLimit.ExclusiveUpdate
member.summary: Performs any pre-solve iteration work that needs exclusive access to the members of the solver updateable. Usually, this is used for applying warmstarting impulses.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.RevoluteLimit.Basis
member.summary: Gets the basis attached to entity A. The primary axis represents the limited axis of rotation. The x axis defines the 'base' direction corresponding to 0 degrees of relative rotation.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.RevoluteLimit.LocalTestAxis
member.summary: Gets or sets the axis attached to entity B in its local space that will be tested against the limits.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.RevoluteLimit.MaximumAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum angle that entities can twist.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.RevoluteLimit.MinimumAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum angle that entities can twist.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.RevoluteLimit.TestAxis
member.summary: Gets or sets the axis attached to entity B in world space that will be tested against the limits.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.RevoluteLimit.RelativeVelocity
member.summary: Gets the current relative velocity between the connected entities with respect to the constraint. The revolute limit is special; internally, it is sometimes two constraints. The X value of the vector is the "minimum" plane of the limit, and the Y value is the "maximum" plane. If a plane isn't active, its error is zero.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.RevoluteLimit.TotalImpulse
member.summary: Gets the total impulse applied by this constraint. The x component corresponds to the minimum plane limit, while the y component corresponds to the maximum plane limit.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.RevoluteLimit.Error
member.summary: Gets the current constraint error. The x component corresponds to the minimum plane limit, while the y component corresponds to the maximum plane limit.

member.summary: Gets the synchronization object locked prior to flipping the internal buffers. Acquiring a lock on this object will prevent the internal buffers from flipping for the duration of the lock.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.EntityStateManagement.InterpolatedStatesManager.BlendAmount
member.summary: Gets or sets the blending amount to use. This is set automatically when the space is using internal timestepping (I.E. when Space.Update(dt) is called). It is a value from 0 to 1 that defines the amount of the previous and current frames to include in the blended state. A value of 1 means use only the current frame; a value of 0 means use only the previous frame.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRules
member.summary: Stores how an object can interact with other objects through collisions.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRules.CollisionGroupRules
member.summary: Defines any special collision rules between collision groups.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRules.DefaultCollisionRule
member.summary: If a CollisionRule calculation between two colliding objects results in no defined CollisionRule, this value will be used.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRules.DefaultDynamicCollisionGroup
member.summary: When a dynamic entity is created and added to a space without having a specific collision group set beforehand, it inherits this collision group. There are no special rules associated with this group by default; entities within this group have normal, full interaction with all other entities. Collision group interaction rules can be overriden by entity personal collision rules or entity-to-entity specific collision rules.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRules.DefaultKinematicCollisionGroup
member.summary:
When a kinematic entity is created and added to a space without having a specific collision group set beforehand, it inherits this collision group. Entities in this collision group will not create collision pairs with other entities of this collision group by default. All other interactions are normal. Collision group interaction rules can be overriden by entity personal collision rules or entity-to-entity specific collision rules.
Non-entity collidable objects like static triangle meshes also use this collision group by default.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRules.GetPersonalCollisionRuleDefault(BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRules,BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRules)
member.summary: Default implementation used to calculate collision rules due to the rulesets' personal rules.
member.returns: Collision rule governing the interaction between the pair.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRules.Group
member.summary: The collision group to which the object owning this instance belongs to. This is overridden by any relationships defined in the Specific collection with CollisionRules other than CollisionRule.Defer. This is also overriden by the Personal CollisionRule if it is anything but CollisionRule.Defer. If the interaction type between the group is defined as CollisionRule.Defer, it is considered to be CollisionRule.normal as the collision group is the final stage.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRules.Personal
member.summary: Determines in general how the object owning this instance should react to other objects. This is overridden by any relationships defined in the Specific collection with CollisionRules other than CollisionRule.Defer. If this is not set to CollisionRule.Defer, it will override the collision group's collision rules.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRules.Specific
member.summary: Specifies how the object owning this instance should react to other individual objects. Any rules defined in this collection will take priority over the Personal collision rule and the collision group's collision rules. Objects that are not in this collection are considered to have a relationship of CollisionRule.Defer.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRules.CollisionRuleCalculator
member.summary: Gets or sets the delegate used to calculate collision rules. Defaults to CollisionRules.GetCollisionRuleDefault.

member.summary: Fires when the contained collision rules are altered.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Threading.SpecializedThreadManager
member.summary: Manages the engine's threads.
member.remarks: Separates the management of ThreadTasks and loops into specialized systems. Should have generally higher performance than the SimpleThreadManager.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Threading.SpecializedThreadManager.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new specialized thread manager that manages loops and tasks separately.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Threading.SpecializedThreadManager.Finalize
member.summary: Releases resources used by the object.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Threading.SpecializedThreadManager.AddThread
member.summary: Adds a new worker thread to the engine.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Threading.SpecializedThreadManager.AddThread(System.Action{System.Object},System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a new worker thread to the engine.
member.param: Function that the new thread will call before entering its work loop.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Threading.SpecializedThreadManager.RemoveThread
member.summary: Removes a worker thread from the engine.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Threading.SpecializedThreadManager.EnqueueTask(System.Action{System.Object},System.Object)
member.summary: Enqueues a task to the thread manager. This should be safe to call from multiple threads and from other tasks.
member.param: Data to give to the task.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Threading.SpecializedThreadManager.ForLoop(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Action{System.Int32})
member.summary: Loops from the starting index (inclusive) to the ending index (exclusive), calling the loopBody at each iteration. The forLoop function will not return until all iterations are complete. This is meant to be used in a 'fork-join' model; only a single thread should be running a forLoop at any time.
member.param: Function that handles an individual iteration of the loop.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Threading.SpecializedThreadManager.WaitForTaskCompletion
member.summary: Waits until all tasks enqueued using enqueueTask are complete.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Threading.SpecializedThreadManager.Dispose
member.summary: Releases resources used by the object.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Threading.SpecializedThreadManager.LoopManager
member.summary: Gets or sets the loop manager used by this threading system. The loop manager is used to specifically parallelize forloops.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Threading.SpecializedThreadManager.TaskManager
member.summary: Gets or sets the task manager used by this threading system. The task manager is used for anything that isn't strictly a for loop.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Threading.SpecializedThreadManager.ThreadCount
member.summary: Gets the number of threads in use by the manager.

member.summary: Broadphase which uses a dynamically changing bounding box tree to calculate overlaps. It has good insertion and update speed.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseSystems.Hierarchies.DynamicHierarchy.MaximumAllowedVolumeFactor
member.summary: When an internal node is revalidated, its volume is stored. When a node's volume exceeds its stored volume multiplied by this factor, it is revalidated again.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseSystems.Hierarchies.DynamicHierarchy.MaximumChildEntityLoad
member.summary: Maximum fraction of a parent's entities that a child can inherit. If a child has as much or more, the validation process is done over again to ensure a more even split.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseSystems.Hierarchies.DynamicHierarchy.MaximumEntitiesInLeaves
member.summary: The maximum number of entities present in the leaf nodes of the hierarchy.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseSystems.Hierarchies.DynamicHierarchy.MinimumNodeEntitiesRequiredToMultithread
member.summary: The number of entities needed in a particular node to use the multithreaded reconstruction method on it. If the node has less, the current thread does the remainder of the subtree itself. This only applies if multithreading is currently being used.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseSystems.Hierarchies.DynamicHierarchy.Root

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionDetectionSettings
member.summary: Settings class containing global information about collision detection.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionDetectionSettings.ContactInvalidationLengthSquared
member.summary:
For persistent manifolds, contacts are represented by an offset in local space of two colliding bodies. The distance between these offsets transformed into world space and projected onto a plane defined by the contact normal squared is compared against this value. If this value is exceeded, the contact is removed from the contact manifold.
If the world is smaller or larger than 'normal' for the engine, adjusting this value proportionally can improve contact caching behavior. The default value of .01f works well for worlds that operate on the order of 1 unit.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionDetectionSettings.ContactMinimumSeparationDistanceSquared
member.summary: In persistent manifolds, if two contacts are too close together, then the system will not use one of them. This avoids redundant constraints.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionDetectionSettings.AllowedPenetration
member.summary: The default amount of allowed penetration into the margin before position correcting impulses will be applied. Defaults to .005f.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionDetectionSettings.DefaultMargin
member.summary: Default collision margin around objects. Margins help prevent objects from interpenetrating and improve stability. Defaults to .04f.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionDetectionSettings.NonconvexNormalAngleDifferenceMinimum
member.summary: In regular convex manifolds, two contacts are considered redundant if their positions are too close together. In nonconvex manifolds, the normal must also be tested, since a contact in the same location could have a different normal. This property is the minimum angle in radians between normals below which contacts are considered redundant.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverSettings
member.summary: Contains information about how a wheel solves its constraints.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverSettings.currentIterations
member.summary: Used to count how many iterations have taken place so far.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverSettings.DefaultMinimumImpulse
member.summary: The value to assign to new constraints' SolverSettings.MinimumImpulse. Impulses with magnitudes below this value will count as effectively zero in determining iteration early outs unless changed in the constraint's solver settings. High values quicken the short circuit but can cause instability, while low values will often prevent short circuiting, possibly increasing accuracy but harming performance. Defaults to .001f.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverSettings.DefaultMinimumIterations
member.summary: The value to assign to new constraints' SolverSettings.MinimumIterations. Constraints are able to skip extra calculations if deemed appropriate after they complete the minimum iterations. Higher values force the system to wait longer before trying to early out, possibly improving behavior. Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverSettings.MaximumIterations
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum iterations that the wheel constraint can undergo. If the space's iteration count is lower than this, the solver will only attempt as many iterations as the space iteration count. Lower iteration counts are less accurate, but can improve performance.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverSettings.MinimumIterations
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum number of iterations that will be applied. If an impulse of magnitude smaller than the MinimumImpulse is applied, a 'tiny impulses' counter increases. Once it exceeds the MinimumIterations, the system can decide to stop solving to save time if appropriate.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverSettings.MinimumImpulse
member.summary: Gets or sets the lower limit for impulses. Impulses applied with magnitudes less than this will increment the 'tiny impulse' counter, which is checked against the MinimumIterations property. If there's been too many tiny impulses in a row, then the system will stop trying to solve to save time. Higher values will allow the system to give up earlier, but can harm accuracy.

member.summary: Averages the two property values.

member.summary: Uses the larger of the two property values.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Materials.PropertyBlendMethod.Min
member.summary: Uses the smaller of the two property values.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Materials.PropertyBlendMethod.BiasHigh
member.summary: Factors in 75% of the high property value of the pair and 25% of the low property value of the pair.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Materials.PropertyBlendMethod.BiasLow
member.summary: Factors in 25% of the high property value of the pair and 75% of the low property value of the pair.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Settings.MotionSettings
member.summary: Contains global settings about motion updating.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.MotionSettings.UseRk4AngularIntegration
member.summary: Whether or not to use RK4 angular integration. This can improve simulation quality sometimes, but not always. It has a slight performance impact. Enabling this when ConserveAngularMomentum is set to true may be helpful.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.MotionSettings.ConserveAngularMomentum
member.summary: Whether or not to conserve angular momentum. This produces slightly more realistic angular behavior, but can reduce stability. Consider using a smaller timestep, enabling RK4 angular integration, or both.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.MotionSettings.DefaultPositionUpdateMode
member.summary: The default position updating mode used by position updateables.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.MotionSettings.UseExtraExpansionForContinuousBoundingBoxes
member.summary: It is possible for an object in danger of being hit by a moving object to have a bounding box which does not contain the resulting motion, and CCD will fail to detect a secondary collision. Setting this to true will take into account nearby objects' velocities and use them to enlarge the bounding box so that secondary collisions are not missed. The larger size of bounding boxes can cause an increase in collision pairs during stressful situations, which can harm performance.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Settings.MotionSettings.CoreShapeScaling
member.summary: The scaling to apply to the core shapes used for continuous collision detection tests. Values should be between 0 and 0.99f. The smaller the value, the smaller the shapes used to perform CCD are, and more collisions are missed.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverGroups.PlaneSliderJoint.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new constraint which restricts one linear degree of freedom between two entities. This constructs the internal constraints, but does not configure them. Before using a constraint constructed in this manner, ensure that its active constituent constraints are properly configured. The entire group as well as all internal constraints are initially inactive (IsActive = false).

Normal of the plane constraint in world space.
Direction in world space along which the X axis LinearAxisLimit and LinearAxisMotor work. This is usually chosen to be perpendicular to the planeNormal and the yAxis.
Direction in world space along which the Y axis LinearAxisLimit and LinearAxisMotor work. This is usually chosen to be perpendicular to the planeNormal and the xAxis.
Location of the anchor for the point to be attached to connectionB in world space.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionResponseSettings
member.summary: Contains global settings relating to the collision response system.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionResponseSettings.BouncinessVelocityThreshold
member.summary: Impact velocity above which the bouciness of the object pair is taken into account. Below the threshold, no extra energy is added.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionResponseSettings.MaximumPositionCorrectionSpeed
member.summary: Maximum speed at which interpenetrating objects or out of alignment joints will attempt to correct. Only applies when the Baumgarte method is used when useSplitImpulsePositionCorrection is set to false for contacts. Defaults to 2.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionResponseSettings.PenetrationRecoveryStiffness
member.summary: Fraction of position error to convert into corrective momentum when using the Baumgarte position correction method, active when useSplitImpulsePositionCorrection is set to false. Defaults to .2.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionResponseSettings.StaticFrictionVelocityThreshold
member.summary: Magnitude of relative velocity at a contact point below which staticFriction is used. dynamicFriction is used when velocity exceeds this threshold. Defaults to .2.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionResponseSettings.TwistFrictionFactor
member.summary: Value by which a collision pair's friction coefficient will be multiplied to get the twist friction coefficient. Defaults to 1.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Joints.SwivelHingeAngularJoint
member.summary: Constrains two bodies so that they can rotate relative to each other like a modified door hinge. Instead of removing two degrees of freedom, only one is removed so that the second connection to the constraint can twist.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Joints.SwivelHingeAngularJoint.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new constraint which allows relative angular motion around a hinge axis and a twist axis. To finish the initialization, specify the connections (ConnectionA and ConnectionB) as well as the WorldHingeAxis and WorldTwistAxis (or their entity-local versions). This constructor sets the constraint's IsActive property to false by default.

member.summary: Constructs a new constraint which allows relative angular motion around a hinge axis and a twist axis.
member.param: Hinge axis attached to connectionA. The connected entities will be able to rotate around this axis relative to each other.
Twist axis attached to connectionB. The connected entities will be able to rotate around this axis relative to each other.

member.name: M:DPSF.IDPSFParticleSystem.AddParticle
member.summary: Adds a new Particle to the particle system, at the start of the Active Particle List. This new Particle is initialized using the particle system's Particle Initialization Function
member.returns: True if a particle was added, False if there is not enough memory for another Particle

member.name: M:DPSF.IDPSFParticleSystem.AddParticles(System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds the specified number of new Particles to the particle system. These new Particles are initialized using the particle systems Particle Initialization Function

member.returns: Returns how many Particles were able to be added to the particle system

member.name: M:DPSF.IDPSFParticleSystem.RemoveAllParticles
member.summary: Removes all Active Particles from the Active Particle List and adds them to the Inactive Particle List

member.name: M:DPSF.IDPSFParticleSystem.Update(System.Single)
member.summary: Updates the Particle System. This involves executing the Particle System Events, updating all Active Particles according to the Particle Events, and adding new Particles according to the Emitter settings.
member.param: How much time in seconds has elapsed since the last time this function was called

member.name: M:DPSF.IDPSFParticleSystem.UpdateForced(System.Single)
member.summary:
Updates the Particle System, even if the the Particle Systems inherits from DrawableGameComponent.
Updating the Particle System involves executing the Particle System Events, updating all Active Particles according to the Particle Events, and adding new Particles according to the Emitter settings.
NOTE: If inheriting from DrawableGameComponent and this is called, the Particle System will be updated twice per frame; once when it is called here, and again when automatically called by the Game object. If not inheriting from DrawableGameComponent, this acts the same as calling Update().
member.param: How much time in seconds has elapsed since the last time this function was called

member.name: M:DPSF.IDPSFParticleSystem.Draw
member.summary: Draws all of the Active Particles to the Graphics Device

member.name: M:DPSF.IDPSFParticleSystem.DrawForced
member.summary:
Draws all of the Active Particles to the Graphics Device, even if the the Particle Systems inherits from DrawableGameComponent.
NOTE: If inheriting from DrawableGameComponent and this is called, the Particle System will be drawn twice per frame; once when it is called here, and again when automatically called by the Game object. If not inheriting from DrawableGameComponent, this acts the same as calling Draw().

member.name: M:DPSF.IDPSFParticleSystem.AutoInitialize(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.GraphicsDevice,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentManager,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch)
member.summary: Virtual function to Initialize the Particle System with default values. Particle system properties should not be set until after this is called, as they are likely to be reset to their default values.
member.param: The Graphics Device the Particle System should use
The Content Manager the Particle System should use to load resources

The Sprite Batch that the Sprite Particle System should use to draw its particles. If this is not initializing a Sprite particle system, or you want the particle system to use its own Sprite Batch, pass in null.

member.name: M:DPSF.IDPSFParticleSystem.SetCameraPosition(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3)
member.summary: Sets the Camera Position of the particle system, so that the particles know how to make themselves face the camera if needed. This virtual function does not do anything unless overridden, and all it should do is set an internal Vector3 variable (e.g. public Vector3 CameraPosition { get; set; }) to match the given Vector3.
member.param: The position that the camera is currently at.

member.name: P:DPSF.IDPSFParticleSystem.Visible
member.summary:
Get / Set if this Particle System should Draw its Particles or not.
NOTE: Setting this to false causes the Draw() function to not draw anything.

member.name: P:DPSF.IDPSFParticleSystem.Enabled
member.summary:
Get / Set if this Particle System should Update itself and its Particles or not.
NOTE: Setting this to false causes the Update() function to not update anything.

member.name: P:DPSF.IDPSFParticleSystem.UpdateOrder
member.summary: The Order in which the Particle System should be Updated relative to other DPSF Particle Systems in the same Particle System Manager. Particle Systems are Updated in ascending order according to their Update Order (i.e. lowest first).

member.name: P:DPSF.IDPSFParticleSystem.DrawOrder
member.summary: The Order in which the Particle System should be Drawn relative to other DPSF Particle Systems in the same Particle System Manager. Particle Systems are Drawn in ascending order according to their Draw Order (i.e. lowest first)

member.name: P:DPSF.IDPSFParticleSystem.Game
member.summary: Get the Game object set in the constructor, if one was given.

member.name: P:DPSF.IDPSFParticleSystem.GraphicsDevice
member.summary: Get the Graphics Device to draw to

member.name: P:DPSF.IDPSFParticleSystem.InheritsDrawableGameComponent
member.summary:
Get if the Particle System is inheriting from DrawableGameComponent or not.
If inheriting from DrawableGameComponent, the Particle Systems are automatically added to the given Game object's Components and the Update() and Draw() functions are automatically called by the Game object when it updates and draws the rest of its Components. If the Update() and Draw() functions are called by the user anyways, they will exit without performing any operations, so it is suggested to include them anyways to make switching between inheriting and not inheriting from DrawableGameComponent seamless; just be aware that the updates and draws are actually being performed when the Game object is told to update and draw (i.e. when base.Update() and base.Draw() are called), not when these functions are being called.

NOTE: Each Particle System is automatically assigned a unique ID when it is instantiated.

member.name: P:DPSF.IDPSFParticleSystem.SimulationSpeed
member.summary:
Get / Set how fast the Particle System Simulation should run.
1.0 = normal speed, 0.5 = half speed, 2.0 = double speed.
NOTE: If a negative value is specified, the Speed Scale is set to zero (pauses the simulation; has same effect as Enabled = false).

member.name: P:DPSF.IDPSFParticleSystem.InternalSimulationSpeed
member.summary:
Get / Set how fast the Particle System Simulation should run to look "normal".
1.0 = normal speed, 0.5 = half speed, 2.0 = double speed.
This is provided as a way of speeding up / slowing down the simulation to have it look as desired, without having to rescale all of the particle velocities, etc.
NOTE: If a negative value is specified, the Internal Simulation Speed is set to zero (pauses the simulation; has the same effect as Enabled = false).

member.name: P:DPSF.IDPSFParticleSystem.UpdatesPerSecond
member.summary:
Specify how often the Particle System should be Updated.
NOTE: Specifying a value of zero (default) will cause the Particle System to be Updated every time the Update() function is called (i.e. as often as possible).
NOTE: If the Update() function is not called often enough to keep up with this specified Update rate, the Update function updates the Particle Systems as often as possible.

member.name: P:DPSF.IDPSFParticleSystem.ParticleSystemManagerToCopyPropertiesFrom
member.summary:
The Particle System Manager whose properties (SimulationSpeed and UpdatesPerSecond) this particle system should follow.
NOTE: This Particle System's properties will only clone the Manager's properties if the Manager's properties are Enabled. For example, the Manager's SimulationSpeed will only be copied to this Particle System if the Manager's SimulationSpeedIsEnabled property is true.
NOTE: This value is automatically set to the last Particle System Manager this Particle System is added to.

member.name: P:DPSF.IDPSFParticleSystem.ParticleType
member.summary: Get the type of Particles that this Particle System should draw.

member.name: P:DPSF.IDPSFParticleSystem.NumberOfParticlesAllocatedInMemory
member.summary:
Get / Set the absolute Number of Particles to Allocate Memory for.
NOTE: This value must be greater than or equal to zero.
NOTE: Even if this many particles aren't used, the space for this many Particles is still allocated in memory.

member.name: P:DPSF.IDPSFParticleSystem.MaxNumberOfParticlesAllowed
member.summary:
Get / Set the Max Number of Particles this Particle System is Allowed to contain at any given time.
NOTE: The Automatic Memory Manager will never allocate space for more Particles than this.
NOTE: This value must be greater than or equal to zero.

member.name: P:DPSF.IDPSFParticleSystem.NumberOfActiveParticles
member.summary: Get the number of Particles that are currently Active

member.name: P:DPSF.IDPSFParticleSystem.NumberOfParticlesBeingDrawn
member.summary: Get the number of Particles being Drawn. That is, how many Particles are both Active AND Visible.

member.name: P:DPSF.IDPSFParticleSystem.NumberOfParticlesStillPossibleToAdd
member.summary: Get the number of Particles that may still be added before reaching the Max Number Of Particles Allowed. If the Max Number Of Particles Allowed is greater than the Number Of Particles Allocated In Memory AND the Auto Memory Manager is set to not increase the amount of Allocated Memory, than this returns the number of Particles that may still be added before running out of Memory.
